Grifols to hold board meeting Tuesday afternoon after Gotham City reportSpanish pharmaceutical company Grifols is set to hold a board meeting on Tuesday afternoon in reaction to a report from Gotham City Research questioning the company's accounting released earlier, board member Tomas Daga told Reuters. China likely dethroned Japan as world's top auto exporter in 2023: China groupChina is estimated to have overtaken Japan as the world's largest auto exporter in 2023, the China Passenger Car Association (CPCA) said on Tuesday, as BYD , Chery and other domestic automakers made major strides overseas. Tue, 09 Jan 2024 11:11:15 GMT XVFNLPWKIVIMBE4TNRHQBQKXUI https://www.reuters.com/business/autos-transportation/china-likely-dethroned-japan-worlds-top-auto-exporter-2023-china-group-2024-01-09/Reuters商业汽车与交通

Britain's Oxford Nanopore's shares sink after revenue warningShares in Britain's Oxford Nanopore dropped nearly 12% on Tuesday, after the sensing technology company issued a revenue warning, citing a slowdown in China and the Middle East, along with staggered purchases from large clients. Chinese auto brands to improve profitability with EV upgrades -UBSChinese auto brands are set for better profitability in 2024 despite intensifying competition in the world's largest auto market, UBS analysts said on Tuesday, thanks to upgrades they have been making in their electric vehicle (EV) product mix. China satellite launch prompts Taiwan alert ahead of pivotal voteTaiwan's government issued an island-wide alert on Tuesday, saying a Chinese satellite had flown over its southern airspace, which Taiwan's foreign minister described as part of a pattern of harassment days before a pivotal election. Tue, 09 Jan 2024 07:50:38 GMT RZZMSS47GZKSDKZMLAI3GHTTZ4 https://www.reuters.com/world/asia-pacific/taiwan-alert-says-chinese-satellite-flies-over-south-taiwan-airspace-2024-01-09/Ben Blanchard, Ryan Woo世界亚太地区
Shares of Spanish drugmaker Grifols plunge after hedge fund queries debt ratiosShares in Spanish drug company Grifols plunged more than 40% on Tuesday after hedge fund Gotham City Research alleged its debt ratios are roughly double those officially reported. Bridge dilemma captures divide over China in Taiwan electionsPointing at Xiamen's skyscrapers across the water from his office, Chen Tsang-chiang recalled how 30 years ago the southern Chinese city was as low-slung as his Taiwanese island of Kinmen. Indonesia ready to work with countries to finalise South China Sea codeIndonesia's Foreign Minister Retno Marsudi said on Tuesday her country is ready to work with other Southeast Asian nations to finalise a long-delayed code of conduct for the South China Sea, where many of its neighbours have overlapping claims with China. Tue, 09 Jan 2024 06:55:08 GMT 3GOTV4NT25NETGL4PHEVWQD5MA https://www.reuters.com/world/asia-pacific/indonesia-ready-work-with-countries-finalise-south-china-sea-code-2024-01-09/Reuters世界亚太地区
Weak economy, COVID rampage likely shrank China's population again in 2023China's population likely dropped for a second consecutive year in 2023 due to a surge in COVID-related deaths after the country abruptly ended strict lockdowns, while weak confidence in the economy's prospects keeps birth rates depressed. Tue, 09 Jan 2024 06:03:47 GMT XPVR74SOVRM4DC37FKIGJX4VOM https://www.reuters.com/world/china/weak-economy-covid-rampage-likely-shrank-chinas-population-again-2023-2024-01-09/Farah Master世界中国
Maldives president courts investors in China as Indian ties sagAt an "Invest Maldives" forum in a southern Chinese port city, Maldivian President Mohamed Muizzu shook hands and exchanged words with smiling local officials on a China visit set to deepen bilateral ties as the archipelagic nation pirouettes away from India.
